meanings.definition: To surpass in glowing or shining.
meanings.sent1: The sun will outglow the stars in the sky tonight.
meanings.sent2: Her smile seemed to outglow all the other smiles in the room.
meanings.sent3: The firefly tried to outglow the streetlamp, but it was no match.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse outglowed the full moon on the dark night.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks outglowed the city skyline, painting the night with colors.

meanings.definition: To emit a brighter light than something else.
meanings.sent1: The new LED light bulb will outglow the old incandescent one.
meanings.sent2: The neon sign outglows all the other signs on the street.
meanings.sent3: The firefly tried to outglow the streetlamp, but it was no match.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse outglowed the full moon on the dark night.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks outglowed the city skyline, painting the night with colors.
